articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Children's Department Store
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Children's Department Store
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, went round the Children's Department Store and apartment houses that have sprang up in Changjon Street.
					 He went round the Children's Department Store nearing completion.
					
					 He looked round various places of the department store from the ground floor to the second floor to learn about its construction.
					
					 He was satisfied to learn that builders successfully completed the huge construction project in a short span of time, bearing deep in mind the noble intention of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il who always projected children as kings of the country and showed loving care for them so that they could grow up with no more to desire in the world.
					
					 He gave precious instructions for managing and operating the department store, saying it is located in the best place facing Mansu Hill where stand the statues of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il who loved the children more than anyone else. 
					
					 Asking officials what measures they took to provide goods for children, he called for minutely organizing the work to steadily improve the service to children as the modern department store has been built as required by the new century.
					
					  It is of particular importance to mass-produce and supply toys for intellectual development to the department store in order to help children develop their intellectual ability and learn scientific principles, he said. 
					
					 Noting that the department store has a large area, he told the officials to arrange not only selling stands but amusement facilities inside the store. When workers of the department store expressed profound thanks for not only making sure that the modern store was built but sparing time to visit their work site, he said with emotion that their gratitude helped him renew his determination to devotedly work for the children, the future of the country. 
					
					   Then he moved to the new apartment houses in Changjon Street.
					
					 He made the rounds of several flats in block 6 and block 1 in the street for a good chunk of time to learn about their construction.
					
					 Going round the interior of several flats built in diverse styles, he acquainted himself with details ranging from sizes of living rooms to kitchen sinks and ventilation of stores.
					
					 He highly praised the builders for having successfully completed the construction of those modern apartment houses, saying that the new apartment houses including those in block 1 in Changjon Street were designed well and construction was carried out on a high level. 
					
					 He set forth important tasks which would serve as guidelines for building Pyongyang as required by the Songun era.
					
					  He was accompanied by Jang Song Thaek, member of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the WPK and vice-chairman of the NDC, Ri Jae Il, first vice department director of the C.C., the WPK, and Ryang Chong Song, vice department director of the C.C., the WPK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Primary School, Nursery and Kindergarten
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Primary School, Nursery and Kindergarten
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, first secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea, first chairman of the DPRK National Defence Commission and supreme commander of the Korean People's Army, provided field guidance to Changjon Primary School, the Kyongsang Nursery and the Kyongsang Kindergarten newly built in Changjon Street. 
					 The first leg of his guidance was Changjon Primary School.
					
					 He saw the place where the statue of President Kim Il Sung will be erected and dropped in at the room devoted to the history of the school. 
					
					 Seeing historic data one by one, he received a report that twice labor hero Kim Su Bok, principal of the school, had the honor of giving a lesson on the Korean language in the presence of the President when he was visiting the school and has worked as teacher and principal of the school for 58 years. He highly praised her for having worked for bringing up children all her life.
					
					 Looking round classrooms from the ground floor to the third floor, he asked officials where desks and chairs were made. He said they were made to suit pupils' ages and heights. 
					
					 Passing through a corridor, he stressed the need to place benches with dress hangers so that pupils may hang wet winter clothes or raincoats in winter and rainy season.
					
					 At the foreign language study room and the computer study room he was pleased that they are well equipped. Entering a spacious lecture hall, he was very satisfied with it, saying that teachers and pupils would like it.
					
					 He said he wanted to see the school's playground and moved to it. He specified tasks for building it better. 
					
					 When he asked officials where pupils are now studying as the school is under construction, he was told that the school would open soon and begin lessons. Hearing this, he promised to revisit it and see pupils in class without fail.
					
					 The second leg of his guidance was the Kyongsang Nursery.
					
					 At the Nursing Baby Room No. 2 he learned about how the room can be kept warm to bring up babies well even in winter. He checked if wind would not come from veranda windows.
					
					 At the room for meals, he personally felt its floor and stressed the need to let children eat meals in the warm room.
					
					 Making the rounds of various education rooms and rooms for intellectual development, he said furniture and facilities have been distributed and arranged well to suit lovely children's mind.
					
					 Underscoring the need to always pay deep attention to bringing up children, the future of the country, he said that the nurses of the Kyongsang Nursery should take warm care of children as their real mothers would do.
					
					 The last leg of his guidance was the Kyongsang Kindergarten.
					
					 After entering its playground, he proposed to provide a circular lawn to children, saying that if the playground is totally paved, children may get hurt while being engrossed in playing.
					
					 He went round the room devoted to the history of the kindergarten.
					
					 He was pleased to hear a report that under the loving care of leader Kim Jong Il the kindergarten successfully did the work to raise the educational level for children's intellectual development and cultural attainments, training a lot of little music talents and pleasing him several times.
					
					 At the playing room on the first floor he said it has been arranged well to suit children's mind and praised the Pyongyang City Designing Institute for designing it well. 
					
					 Making the rounds of various rooms on each floor, he said the more he saw, the more he liked. He repeatedly said he was most pleased with this visit and he liked everything.
					
					 When he dropped in at the hall on the ground floor, he was told that children were waiting for him to see a performance. He would like to watch it despite the pressure of time, he said. He spared time to enjoy it. 
					
					 As the performance was over, he asked the child who presented a vocal solo to come to him and kindly held the child in his arms. He learned the age of the child and the jobs of the child's parents and praised the child for singing well, fondling the child's cheek. He sat on the stage unreservedly and had a photo taken with children, holding them in his arms.
					
					 Kindly bidding farewell to the children saying goodbye to him, he told officials that he would visit the kindergarten again and meet with all kindergarteners without fail.
					
					 He was accompanied by Jang Song Thaek, member of the Political Bureau of the WPK Central Committee and vice-chairman of the National Defence Commission, Ri Jae Il, first vice department director of the WPK Central Committee, and Ryang Chong Song and Pak Chun Hong, vice department directors of the WPK Central Committee.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam Meets Pakistani Ambassador
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Meets Pakistani Ambassador
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, met and had a talk with Arif Mahmood, Pakistani ambassador to the DPRK who paid a farewell call on him, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Wednesday.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Visits Chemical Complex
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Visits Chemical Complex
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Choe Yong Rim, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea, on Wednesday visited the Sunchon Chemical Complex to make field survey of its work.
					 The complex associated with the leadership provided by the great persons of Mt. Paektu updated the methanol-producing process and other major processes and established a general production command system true to the behest of leader Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 As a result, it laid a material and technological foundation for keeping the vinalon production going at a high rate. 
					
					 The premier made the rounds of the carbide shop, spinning shop and other places of the complex. He appreciated the signal successes made by its workers in the project for updating the production processes true to the intention of the party.
					
					 He underlined the need to conduct the technical control over the carbide production process and manage equipment in a responsible manner and push forward the work to increase the production of basic chemical goods and their variety. 
					
					 He, at the same time, underscored the need to energetically speed up the updating of equipment by making an effective use of the existing production foundation.
					
					 He called on the officials and workers to wind up the updating of vinalon production process as early as possible in hearty response to the slogan "Push back the frontiers of latest science and technology!" put up by the party and took measures for relevant units to substantially provide necessary raw and other materials.
					
					 He stressed the need for the complex to pay deep attention to the life of its workers and fulfil its duty in developing the country's economy and improving the standard of people's living true to the dear respected Kim Jong Un's noble outlook on the people.

articles.title: Choe Ryong Hae Visits Sporting Center
articles.content:
Choe Ryong Hae Visits Sporting Center
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Choe Ryong Hae, member of the Presidium of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Workers' Party of Korea and director of the General Political Bureau of the Korean People's Army, on Wednesday made field survey of the Sporting Center in Thongil Street.
					 The construction of the modern center for the promotion of the people's health started at the initiative of the dear respected Kim Jong Un and under his plan.  It is now nearing its completion.
					
					 There are in the center with a huge plottage hundreds of sports apparatuses of various kinds, recuperation rooms, table tennis halls, a supersonic wave wading pool, etc.
					
					 Choe Ryong Hae went round various places of the center associated with footsteps left by Supreme Commander Kim Jong Un with loving care for the people.
					
					 Choe underscored the need for builders to fully display the serve-the-people spirit in building, bearing deep in mind the intention of the supreme commander to make the people fully enjoy wealth and prosperity under socialism.
					
					 Each sports apparatus is associated with the warm loving care of the supreme commander, Choe said, calling for managing apparatuses and equipment well to provide convenience to visitors on a priority basis. 
					
					 Going round the meat and fish shop conducive to improving the diet of people, he underscored the need for the officials and servants of the center to fufil their responsibility and role, deeply cherishing their mission as the servants of the people in hearty response to the party's slogan "We Serve the People!" 
					
					 He stressed the need for the soldier-builders to thoroughly implement the order of the supreme commander and successfully complete the center as early as possible.

articles.title: Russian Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Russian Delegation Pays Tribute to Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- A Russian financial and economic delegation headed by Vice-Minister of Finance Sergey Storchak visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill in Pyongyang on Wednesday to pay tribute to them.
					 After laying bouquets before the statutes, they made a bow. The delegation arrived in Pyongyang on Wednesday.

articles.title: Pomminryon S. Headquarters Vice-Chairman Tours Pyongyang
articles.content:
Pomminryon S. Headquarters Vice-Chairman Tours Pyongyang
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Ro Su Hui, vice-chairman of the South Headquarters of the Pan-national Alliance for Korea's Reunification (Pomminryon), visited the Ponghwa Revolutionary Site.
					 At the site associated with the footprints of Kim Hyong Jik, indomitable revolutionary fighter and outstanding leader of the anti-Japanese national liberation movement in Korea, the vice-chairman looked round Myongsin School, dwelling houses and the Pisok-gye Monument.
					
					 The vice-chairman toured production processes of the Taedonggang Beer Factory which has been built into a modern soft drink production base under the great loving care of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He also visited Kim Jong Suk Nursery and the King Tangun's Mausoleum.

articles.title: Iranian Embassy Donates Farming Materials to Co-op Farm
articles.content:
Iranian Embassy Donates Farming Materials to Co-op Farm
Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The Iranian embassy in Pyongyang donated farming materials to the DPRK-Iran Friendship Ripsok Co-op Farm in Mundok County, South Phyongan Province on the week of DPRK-Iran friendship.
					A donating ceremony took place on Wednesday.
					
					Present there were members of the DPRK-Iran Friendship Association, farmers, Iranian Ambassador to the DPRK Morteza Moradian and his embassy officials. 
					
					A letter of donation was conveyed after speeches.
					
					The ambassador wished officials and farmers working in the farm associated with the leadership feats of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il greater achievements in agricultural production.
					
					He expressed belief that the relations between the two countries would grow stronger.

articles.title: Preparations for Celebrations of KCU Birthday Finished
articles.content:
Preparations for Celebrations of KCU Birthday Finished
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Pyongyang City is now waiting for the arrival of the delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU), which falls on June 6, after having rounded off all preparations to host them.
					 All departments under the celebration preparatory committee have completed their own preparations in close relationship with relevant units. 
					
					 20 000 exemplary KCU members were appointed delegates from all primary and secondary schools and their branches throughout the country, including remote mountainous villages in the northern tip of the country, villages adjacent to the Military Demarcation Line and solitary islets.
					
					 Timetables for trains, planes, ships and vehicles, due to carry the delegates to Pyongyang, have already been set.
					
					 Meanwhile, the lodging destination is ready to accommodate them. Itineraries have been scheduled in detail, with venues of celebrations face-lifted.
					
					 The city's well-known restaurants have finished a work to serve special diets exclusively for the delegates.
					
					 Preparations for celebration performances have come to an end on the highest level at national art troupes, the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace and the Pyongyang Students and Children's Palace.
					
					 The Kaeson Youth Park Funfair and the Central Zoo, too, are waiting for the arrivals' visits.

articles.title: Selection of KCU Delegates Finished in DPRK
articles.content:
Selection of KCU Delegates Finished in DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- A work has been finished to select delegates to the celebrations of the 66th anniversary of the Korean Children's Union (KCU) in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Kim Nam Chol, department director of the Kim Il Sung Socialist Youth League, told KCNA:
					
					 "The selection of the KCU delegates was conducted under the deep care of the Party and the State and amid the expectation of all the people.
					
					Attending the forthcoming celebrations of the KCU anniversary in Pyongyang will be 20,000 delegates selected in provinces, cities and counties across the country. Most of them are schoolchildren from industrial areas including coal mining districts, rural areas, solitary islets and remote mountain villages.
					
					 The delegates have distinguished themselves in study and KCU organizational life and in do-good-thing campaign including rabbit-raising and tree-planting.
					
					 They and their parents as well as their schools and villages are now in an ecstasy of joy."

articles.title: April 25 Hotel, Lodging Destination of KCU Delegates
articles.content:
April 25 Hotel, Lodging Destination of KCU Delegates
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The April 25 Hotel in Pyongyang is now busy with preparations for accommodating delegates to the celebrations of the 66th birthday of the Korean Children's Union (KCU).
					 The hotel has been refurnishing barbershops, bathrooms and laundries to better the children's convenience.
					
					 Confectionary and subsidiary foodstuffs have been fully secured.
					
					 Kim Jong Hwa, who has been working at the hotel as a maid for eight years, told KCNA:
					
					 "The news my hotel will accommodate the KCU delegates has deeply excited me. It is the first time for the hotel to receive tens of thousands of little delegates at the same time. I will make every possible effort in favor of their conveniences with maternal care."
					
					 Jo Yong Il, manager of the hotel, said:
					
					 "All employees spend days and nights for the preparations. Senior party and state officials are frequently visiting the hotel to instantly solve knotty problems. Preparations for receiving the little kings of the country have been near to an end."

articles.title: Taedonggang Swellfish Farm Goes Operational
articles.content:
Taedonggang Swellfish Farm Goes Operational
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The Taedonggang Swellfish Farm on the west coast of the DPRK went operational with due ceremony Wednesday.
					 The farm, built on the basis of modern fish-breeding science and technology, has more than 160 indoor and outdoor ponds and over 10 annexes. A scientific system of managing the ponds is in place.
					
					 It has become possible to breed in an industrial way the swellfish known as a tonic and rare delicious fish.
					
					 Attending the ceremony were Ro Tu Chol, vice-premier of the Cabinet, officials concerned, soldier-builders and employees of the farm.

articles.title: DPRK Prove Successful in Open Track and Field in Taipei
articles.content:
DPRK Prove Successful in Open Track and Field in Taipei
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- DPRK women players proved successful in the Open Track and Field Competition in Taipei, China on May 25 and 26.
					 It brought together more than 120 excellent players from over 20 countries and regions.
					
					 Kim Chun Mi and Pak Kum Hyang placed first in women's 1,500m race and women's 3,000m hurdles.
					
					 Kim Son Hui placed second in women's 5,000m race.
					
					 They came back home Tuesday.

articles.title: Non-smoking Research Centre
articles.content:
Non-smoking Research Centre
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- On the occasion of the World No-Tobacco Day (May 31), KCNA visited the Non-smoking Research Centre in Sosong District, Pyongyang 
					 The Centre renders services on smoke quitting.
					
					  Smokers are able to know in its counsel office about the adverse effect smoking gives on human body, smoke-quitting methods and the experiences other people gained in quitting smoking.
					
					 The Centre makes visitors be aware of the harmful effects of smoking on families, society and environment through video and wall pictures. 
					
					 It also sells tobacco substitutes.
					
					 The anti-smoking pill helps remove nicotine from human body to deprive a smoker of appetite for smoking. It is said one would get to lose desire for smoking three to five days after taking the pills. The pills are applicable to passive smokers, too.
					
					 Put on sale in the Centre are also no-tobacco pipes and anti-smoking gums.

articles.title: Ryonghung Flower Shop
articles.content:
Ryonghung Flower Shop
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Ryonghung Flower Shop in Taesong District, Pyongyang is always crowded with people.
					 The glass-covered U-shaped building draws eyes of passersby.
					
					Its saleswomen kindly recommend choosing a desirable kind of flowers in accordance with recipients' sex and ages.
					
					 The shop makes ordered flowers, too.
					
					 Also available in the shop are flower-decorating designs helpful to face-lifting homes and worksites. 
					
					 Ri In Suk (48), living in Central District, Pyongyang, said:
					
					 "There is a flower shop not distant from my house. But I became a customer of this shop."

articles.title: Jang Un San, Mass Gymnastics Producer of DPRK
articles.content:
Jang Un San, Mass Gymnastics Producer of DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Jang Un San is one of the experienced mass gymnastics producers in the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 Born in Kaechon City, South Phyongan Province, Jang started his career at the Mass Gymnastics Production Company in 1976 after graduating from Kim Hyong Jik University of Education.
					
					 In his twenties he successfully carried out the production of a section of mass gymnastic display "Song of Korea", a scene performed by at least 1,000 gymnasts. His admirable talent and organizing ability drew deep attention of the mass gymnastics production world.
					
					 Since 1981, he had acted as the general conductor of the background, one of the three main components of mass gymnastics. In the course of producing and conducting the backgrounds in several mass gymnastic displays, he further improved his construction ability, which is to shape vast space and huge personnel into an organic one, and got senses of a mass gymnastics producer.
					
					 Typical of the works directed by him is the mass gymnastic display "Do Prosper, My Motherland", created to celebrate the 60th anniversary of the DPRK.
					
					 During his life of 36 years as a creator Jang produced tens of mass gymnastic displays and spread the DPRK's experience and technique of mass gymnastics production among other countries.
					
					 He was awarded Kim Il Sung Prize in 2006 and the title of People's Athlete in 2001 for his signal contribution to the development of the nation's mass gymnastics.
					
					 Jang Un San, deputy head of the Mass Gymnastics Production Company, is now directing the production of grand gymnastic and artistic performance "Arirang".

articles.title: US and S. Korea's Saber-rattling under Fire: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
US and S. Korea's Saber-rattling under Fire: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The south Korean Lee Myung Bak group of traitors frantically staged Thaeguk war exercises from May 21 to 25 under the pretext of dealing with someone's colorful "provocation threat" in the wake of its largest-ever joint air battle drill staged with the U.S. from last May 7 to 18.
					 Minju Joson Wednesday observes in a bylined commentary in this regard:
					
					 This clearly indicates that the group of traitors is getting crazy in its moves to ignite a war of aggression against the north in collusion with outside forces.
					
					 The commentary says that the above-said drills were designed to cope with someone's "additional provocations" but this is sheer nonsense.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 It is not the DPRK but the U.S. imperialists and the Lee Myung Bak group that are perpetrating provocations on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 This time too, the U.S. mobilized an air refueling tanker, AWACS and other military hardware for the joint air battle drill. Their operational sphere is far beyond the boundary of the peninsula. It is a very serious development that the U.S. hurled the air refueling tanker and AWACS into the drill with the puppet forces. This bespeaks that the U.S. puts not only the DPRK but also the rest of Northeast Asia in the range of its air strike.
					
					 As a matter of fact, the U.S. is beefing up its armed forces in the Asia-Pacific region according to its new defence strategy whereby it shifted its military focus to the region. Its aim is to occupy the peninsula by force of arms and dominate the Asia-Pacific region with it as a springboard.
					
					 The group of traitors has frantically staged war exercises to invade the north according to the U.S. scenario.
					
					 The group is working hard to shift the responsibility for the strained situation on the peninsula on to the DPRK and, at the same time, gives full rein to the nuclear war chariot of the U.S., rendering the situation not only on the peninsula but in the rest of Asia extremely tense.
					
					 Such facts clearly prove that the U.S. and rat-like Lee group are chiefly to blame for bedeviling the inter-Korean relations and driving the situation on the peninsula and the rest of Asia to a dangerous phase.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Accuses Lee Myung Bak of Its Confrontation Policy
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Accuses Lee Myung Bak of Its Confrontation Policy
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The policy of confrontation with fellow countrymen pursued by the Lee Myung Bak group of south Korea is bound to go bust for its injustice and traitorous nature. 
					 Rodong Sinmun Wednesday says this in a bylined article.
					
					 The Lee group's policy of confrontation with compatriots is a policy against reunification as it is quite contrary to the idea of "By our nation itself", the keynote of the inter-Korean declarations, and a war policy blocking peace on the Korean Peninsula and national prosperity, the article notes, and goes on:
					
					 The Lee group's moves to escalate confrontation with fellow countrymen while denying the idea of "By our nation itself" have gone to such pass as daring hurt the dignity of the supreme leadership of the DPRK.
					
					 It is quite natural for all Koreans who love the country and nation to slam the crimes perpetrated by the group of traitors and renew their determination to settle accounts with it a thousand times.
					
					 Had the Lee group not pursued a policy of confrontation with fellow countrymen and approached all issues from the viewpoint of giving priority to the nation and national interests, the inter-Korean relations would have not reached such phase of catastrophe where only confrontation persists without any dialogue and cooperation and a proud era of independent reunification, peace and prosperity would have been ushered in.
					
					 It is the unanimous desire and wish of all Koreans at home and abroad to reunify the country in a peaceful atmosphere free from aggression, war, domination and subjugation and achieve development and prosperity common to the nation.
					
					 The Koreans can never live in peace and the Korean Peninsula can hardly escape a nuclear holocaust as long as the Lee group of traitors is allowed to sell off national interests to outsiders, placing them above the nation.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits in Building Revolutionary Party Praised
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits in Building Revolutionary Party Praised
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article praises the undying feats leader Kim Jong Il performed by developing the Workers' Party of Korea into the organizer and guide of all victories of our people. 
					 The article says:
					
					 Kim Jong Il developed the WPK into the invincible party glorifying with the august name of the leader and his revolutionary idea and demonstrating its might with single-minded unity and Songun politics for decades. 
					
					 The precious exploits of Kim Jong Il in the history of building the revolutionary party of Juche type is that he developed the WPK into the revolutionary party which established an ideological system of the leader and his leadership system, the mother party serving the people which formed a harmonious whole with the masses and an invincible party with steel-like disciplines and militancy. 
					
					 The whole party has strictly abided by the principles in establishing the party's monolithic ideological system laid down by Kim Jong Il generation after generation. As a result, the WPK has been equipped with the monolithic ideology of the leader and become a strong political organization which acts as one under the monolithic leadership of the leader. 
					
					 Thanks to his wise leadership, the WPK could strike deep roots among broad popular masses and demonstrate its dignity as a revolutionary party with blood ties with the people and a mother party taking care of the people's destiny and future to the last. 
					
					 The revolutionary trait of fully implementing the line and policies laid down by the leader have been established among all party organizations and party members and the party has achieved perfect unity in thinking and action. 
					
					 The WPK will always exalt its dignity and honor as the glorious party guided by Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism, taking the exploits of Kim Jong Il in party building as guidelines.

articles.title: Military Capabilities Guarantee Sovereignty to Existence: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
Military Capabilities Guarantee Sovereignty to Existence: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Only strong military muscle can batter the imperialist reactionary forces' moves to dominate others, and the self-defensive military capabilities guarantee the sovereignty of a nation and its right to existence, says Rodong Sinmun Wednesday in a bylined article. 
					 If a nation is weak in its military capabilities, it can not defend its sovereignty and right to existence but might fall victim to the imperialists as their plaything, says the article, adding:
					
					 The popular masses' struggle for independence and socialism is accompanied by a showdown with the imperialist forces. It is a showdown between the political, economic and military forces as well as a life-or-death fight.
					
					 So, to bolster the military muscle is a crucial issue on which hinge the victory and failure of the revolution and the rise and fall of a nation.
					
					 The smaller a nation is, the more crucial the matter is. This is a serious lesson taught by the historical experience.
					
					 Only the self-defensive military capabilities, not a word, can reliably protect the sovereignty and right to existence.
					
					 This has been proved by the practical experience of the Korean revolution.
					
					 The powerful military muscle of the DPRK helped it have the pluck to bear the brunt of the imperialists and international reactionaries' reckless military offensives.
					
					 The revolutionary forces of the DPRK will fulfill their mission and role in heading off a war and defending its sovereignty and right to existence.
					
					 The article calls upon the parties and peoples making revolution to push ahead with the work to increase the military capabilities under the banner of Songun.

articles.title: KCNA Accuses US of Stretching out Dark Tentacles to "Election" in S. Korea
articles.content:
KCNA Accuses US of Stretching out Dark Tentacles to "Election" in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- A series of south Korean junkets paid by U.S. experts on Korean affairs and confabs held by them with south Korea recently are arousing great caution among Koreans of different social circles at home and abroad.
					 It was reported that a delegation of the House of Representatives led by the chairman of the Foreign Relations Committee of the House of Representatives flew into south Korea on May 23 to be followed by experts on Korean affairs of the U.S. Centre for Strategic and International Studies and former senior bureaucrats. They separately met and held huddles with pro-U.S. conservative elements including traitor Lee Myung Bak and Park Geun Hye.
					
					 They were reported to have cried out for "cooperation" and "joint counter-action" over someone's "nuclear and missile and human rights issues" and showed "deep concern" for "presidential election" slated to take place in south Korea in December.
					
					 Lurking behind these moves is a sinister intention of the U.S. to zealously prop up the ultra-right conservative forces in south Korea, the first line shock brigade for implementing the hostile policy towards the DPRK, and prolong the pro-U.S. conservative regime in a bid to stifle the DPRK without fail.
					
					 As well known to the world, the U.S. interference and control over the internal affairs of south Korea are nothing new.
					
					 The maintenance and replacement of the pro-U.S. puppet regime are considered as an important foreign policy issue of the U.S. Administration in strengthening the political and military domination upon south Korea, a stronghold for realizing the U.S. Asian strategy.
					
					 Accordingly, all successive south Korean puppets' assumption of office and their end are decided by the U.S.
					
					 The U.S. is still busy further increasing than ever before the tension on the Korean Peninsula, outpost for carrying out its strategy to stifle the DPRK, and, at the same time, hatching plots against the DPRK with new and old conservative forces of south Korea involved.
					
					 This is evidenced by the fact that the U.S. is stretching out its dark tentacles to the forthcoming "election" at a time when the Lee group of traitors is kicking up a whirlwind of suppression of pro-reunification progressive organizations and figures under the watchword of "eliminating the forces following the north."
					
					 It is the scenario of the U.S. to turn the political situation before the "election" favorable to the Lee group as it will be a platform to judge the present regime in south Korea so as to maintain traitor Lee's pro-U.S. policy and, at the same time, call back the departed soul of the harsh pro-U.S. dictatorship by supporting the "Saenuri Party", a group of pro-U.S. lackeys, and the daughter of "yusin" dictator as part of its intrigues.
					
					 As all facts show, genuine independence, democratization and the reunification movement in the south Korean society can hardly be expected as long as the political and military domination of the U.S. over south Korea goes on.
					
					 It is quite natural for south Korean people of various circles and youth and students to rise up in resistance, disillusioned with the Lee group of traitors' pro-U.S. and sycophantic policy.

articles.title: KCNA Ridicules Lee Myung Bak's Much Ado about "Forces Following North"
articles.content:
KCNA Ridicules Lee Myung Bak's Much Ado about "Forces Following North" 
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Traitor Lee Myung Bak chiefly to blame for concocting the story about "forces following the north" made public appearance to raise a hue and cry over it, not content with the ruckus kicked up by his yes men. 
					 Lee in his appearance over a broadcasting service on Monday blustered that there should be a change in the "attitude of those who blindly sympathize with the assertion of the north including that over the 'Cheonan' warship case."
					
					 At a time when rat-like gangsters are going reckless with the smear campaign over "forces following the north," even their boss came out to cry out for a switchover in the attitude of "forces following the north." Why?
					
					 The story about "forces following the north" is a version of the "theory of coloring" crafted by the conservative forces in south Korea to crack down upon the progressive pro-reform forces by branding them as "pro-north leftist elements."
					
					 The story spread by the Lee group is nothing but a stratagem to turn the political situation ahead of the "presidential election" favorable to it as its ulterior motive is very clear.
					
					 It is the Lee's group that used to libel its political rivals "forces following the north" with each election as an occasion. 
					
					 During the 2010 elections to local self-governing bodies and the subsequent by-elections, the group branded as "forces following the north" the progressive forces that demanded a probe into the warship sinking case and stop to confrontation with fellow countrymen.
					
					 A politician who ran for the governor of south Korean Kangwon Province on the ticket of the Democratic Party was branded as a "pro-north leftist" for the mere reason that he made a speech denying the story that "'Cheonan' was sunk  by the north's explosion".
					
					 Finding itself on the verge of ruin, forsaken by the public for its domestic and foreign policy failures, the Lee group orchestrated a shocking farce about "forces following the north" in a bid to turn the political situation before the "presidential election" favorable to it and thus prolong its remaining days.
					
					 Not content with labeling progressive organizations and figures "forces following the north" and "leftist forces," the Lee group went the lengths of branding even candidates from opposition parties as "members of the leftist group directly linked to the north".
					
					 This is no more than the last-ditch efforts to foil "the call for judging the regime" made by people of different social standings and the forces demanding democracy and reforms.
					
					 The Lee group is making desperate efforts to weather its crisis, again spreading the story. But history has already meted out a judgment to it.
					
					 The nation will never pardon the regime of traitors as it most seriously deteriorated the economy and people's livelihood after reviving the fascist dictatorship and brought the once favorably developed inter-Korean relations to a total collapse in four years of its office. One's evil doings would rebound on himself.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Regime Ridden with Scandals
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Regime Ridden with Scandals
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak regime rotten to its core is on the verge of collapse.
					 No sooner had rat-like Lee come to power than trumpeted "it would be a morally perfect regime" and "there would be no scandal among his confidants during the tenure of his office."
					
					 Nowadays he finds himself in such deplorable position that he seems to be dumb.
					
					 The rat-like Lee group is called "corrupt regime", "ditch-like regime", "regime of rags" and "department store of scandals".
					
					 Rat-like Lee is the kingpin of all scams in south Korea.
					
					While working at Hyundai Construction Co., he was involved in the Hyundai apartment houses special sale, sparking off public uproar. It was disclosed that he was managing 1,313 phyong of Togok land in Kangnam District after registering it in 1985 in the name of his wife's brother only to experience a hot agony of shame. When he was Seoul mayor, he committed a scandal which helped his family and relatives make undue profits through real estate speculation. In 1993 he was involved in the flower village speculation case in Socho-dong by taking advantage of the development of Socho-dong area.
					
					 He became so upbeat after becoming "president" that he has committed hideous scams one after another. 
					
					 He was also the chief culprit of BBK case and a license scandal, social problems still left unsolved since 2007.
					
					 While living in a deluxe mansion worth 3,580 million won in Ronhyon-dong, Kangnam District, he committed the Naegok-dong housing lot purchase scandal in which he spent a stupendous amount of money stained with sweat and blood of people under the pretext of building his house after his retirement.
					
					 Out of his families and relatives more than 100 persons are blacklisted as "dangerous elements" likely to be involved in scandals and 13 of them have already been suspected of scams or are behind bars. Countless are scandals committed by his elder cousin, wife's brother, cousins-in-law and niece's husband, etc. including the bribery case in which the former aide of his elder brother Lee Sang Duk was involved. 
					
					 Scandals were also committed by his confidants holding important posts of the regime. Involved in scandals were the members of the "six-men society" who zealously backed the rule of rat-like Lee group of traitors after holding enormous power for playing a big role in installing the "pragmatic regime."
					
					 It was disclosed that Choe Si Jung, known as a "political advisor" to Lee, received a large amount of money from a construction company for giving license to the development project in Ryangjae-dong, Seoul and spent it for conducting an opinion poll during the 2007 "presidential election." This forced him to resign from the post of chairman of the Broadcasting and Communication Committee.
					
					 Various scams disclosed in an unbroken chain included the enveloped money case of the former senior secretary for political affairs of Chongwadae, the bribery case worth a hundred million won of the former vice-minister of Culture, Sports and Tourism, the hideous bribery case of the former vice-minister of Knowledge Economy and the bribery case of the former manager of the Seoul City Railway Corporation.
					
					 Some days ago, Kim Chan Gyong, former president of the Mirae Savings Bank, was detained on charges of illegal loan and expropriation of 500 billion won and Im Sok, president of the Solomon Savings Bank, was imprisoned on the charge of whisking away 17 billion won from the bank and illegal loan of 150 billion won.
					
					 A total of 50 minister-level persons have been appointed through 16 cabinet reshuffles till now. 45 of them have records of involvement in corruptions such as real estate speculation, tax evasion, paper plagiarism, conscription evasion and false moving-in. The biggest encyclopedia of scandals in history is being compiled by families and relatives of Lee Myung Bak and those in power. This is the assertion of south Korean media.
					
					 Scandals can never be brought to an end in south Korea as long as the hotbed of corruption and the chief culprit of immorality are allowed to be at large.
					
					 Such human scam as rat-like Lee Myung Bak group should be eliminated as early as possible.

articles.title: More Crimes against Koreans by Japanese Imperialists Disclosed
articles.content:
More Crimes against Koreans by Japanese Imperialists Disclosed
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- KBS of south Korea disclosed on Monday that the Japanese imperialists hurled the Koreans who were taken to Japan for forced labor to battlefields during World War II.
					 Recently opened to the public was a testimony made by the former commander of defense corps of the Imperial Japanese Army more than 20 years ago.
					
					 According to it, the Japanese imperialists took lots of Koreans to Okinawa, Japan in labor conscription and forced them to carry explosives and do other dangerous work.
					
					 At a time when the Japanese army was fighting ground warfare against the U.S. army that landed on Okinawa in 1945, it forced the Koreans to dash into the U.S. tanks with explosives on their back, threatening to kill if they run away.
					
					 Over 10 000 drafted Koreans were forced to the battle against the U.S. army.
					
					 Pak Su Nam, a Korean-Japanese documentary film director, collected relevant data on the basis of the testimony and buckled down to producing a documentary film.
					
					 Despite the Japanese authorities' pressure, Pak made public the film to disclose the Japanese imperialists' brutal crimes after more than 50 years.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries can not curtain off the truth of history no matter how hard they attempt to deny and distort the crimes they committed against the Korean nation and evade the responsibility for them.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Works Posted Abroad
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Works Posted Abroad
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The full text of the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "Let's Dynamically Struggle for a Final Victory, Holding Aloft the Banner of Songun" was posted on the Internet website by the Finnish National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on May 22.
					 He said in his speech on April 15, 2012 that the 100-year long history of Kim Il Sung's nation clearly proved the iron truth that outstanding leaders assure the dignity and prosperity of a country and nation. 
					
					 Clarified in the speech is an idea that the glorious 100-year long history of Juche Korea and the eternal history of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea are guaranteed by the ever-victorious history of the Korean People's Army.
					
					 It indicates the tasks to be fulfilled to glorify the dignity of Songun Korea for all ages and successfully accomplish the cause of building a thriving socialist nation, etc.
					
					 The detailed content of his work "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirements for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation" was posted on the Internet website by the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of the Juche Idea on May 20. 
					
					The work, published on April 27, 2012, clarifies the undying exploits performed by President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il in land management and indicates the general orientation and tasks for face-lifting the country's land as befitting that of a thriving socialist nation.

articles.title: Russians Give Impression of DPRK
articles.content:
Russians Give Impression of DPRK
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- A meeting was held in Moscow on May 17 to hear the report by the members of the delegation of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK. They visited the DPRK to participate in the celebrations of the centenary of the birth of President Kim Il Sung.
					 Chairman of the Association Victor Petrov said in the meeting:
					
					 The celebrations of the President's birth anniversary were beyond imagination, something that can not be seen in any other part of the world.
					
					 Young Kim Jong Un, identical to Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il, made a speech in the military parade in commemoration of the Day of the Sun. It was a great event that drew the global attention.
					
					 We were also moved to see the Korean people cheering in tears looking up to him and this helped us experience the might of the DPRK.
					
					 Zhukova, manager of the Korean Koryo Medical Centre in Moscow, praised Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as great men who brought up the people to be the purest and most conscientious, brave and disciplined one in the world.
					
					 She said she was greatly touched to see the Korean people warmly cheer the dear respected Kim Jong Un, throwing themselves into his arms and rally close around him arms in arms and shoulder to shoulder on TV during the stay in the DPRK.
					
					 The vice president of the Moscow Peace Fund renewed the pledge to positively contribute to the development of the bilateral relations of friendship and cooperation in the future, noting that the celebrations of the Day of the Sun helped realize the Korean people's trust in Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Work Praised by British Organizations
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Work Praised by British Organizations
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The British Association for the Study of Songun Policy and the British Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on May 18 upon receiving the dear respected Kim Jong Un's work "On Effecting a Drastic Turn in Land Management to Meet the Requirements for Building a Thriving Socialist Nation".
					 His work sets forth the tasks to spruce up the DPRK as a socialist paradise by making a radical change in the land management, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 Kim Jong Un, great successor to the Juche cause and Songun cause, puts forth the general orientation for land management true to the noble and patriotic will of leader Kim Jong Il.
					
					 His work is important guidelines for face-lifting the country's land as befitting that of a thriving socialist nation as it comprehensively deals with the behests of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as regards the land management.
					
					 We are confident the Korean people would turn their land into the socialist paradise guided by Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: Bangladeshi Figure Supports DPRK's Stand
articles.content:
Bangladeshi Figure Supports DPRK's Stand
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Garib Newaz, president of the Bangladesh People's League, made public a statement on May 18 in support of the white paper of the Korean Jurists Committee denouncing the application of the double standards by the U.S.
					 He said:
					
					 The Korean Jurists Committee made public a white paper as regards the open negation of the principles of respect for sovereignty and equal sovereignty, the fundamental principles of the UN Charter, and the grave infringement on the independent rights of sovereign countries by the U.S. application of double standards at the UNSC session.
					
					 The U.S., pursuant to its ambition for world domination, has employed the double standards against those countries aspiring after independence against imperialism, while taking no account of the missions and roles of international law and organizations.
					
					 Justice and truth in the international relations would be violated if the U.S. is allowed to go ahead with its ambition of world domination by applying the double standards in the international arena. 
					
					 We call upon all the jurists around the world to voice support for the Korean people against the U.S. double standards, extending full support to the white paper.

articles.title: Chinese Media Reports News of Sojourn in Pyongyang of Cho Islet Students
articles.content:
Chinese Media Reports News of Sojourn in Pyongyang of Cho Islet Students
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- Chinese media reported on May 24 and 25 that students on Cho Islet, the front post on the west sea of the DPRK, spent pleasant times during Pyongyang visit under the care of the dear respected Kim Jong Un.
					 The Chinese Report Broadcasting said:
					
					 Kim Jong Un took a step to let schoolchildren on Cho Islet visit Pyongyang.
					
					 He, being considerate of their ardent wish to visit Pyongyang, made sure that they visit Pyongyang and have joyful camping in good season.
					
					 Upon their arrival in the capital they visited the statues of President Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il on Mansu Hill to lay bouquets and flowers and pay tribute to them.  
					
					 They toured Mangyongdae, the President's birthplace, the Kimilsungia-Kimjongilia Exhibition, the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong, the Party Founding Memorial Tower, the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace, revolutionary sites and apartment houses in Mansudae area nearing its completion. 
					
					 The same news was reported by the Phoenix Satellite TV Holdings LTD., Hong Kong, China, and the Internet websites People network, News network and Economy network.

articles.title: DPRK's Opera "The Flower Girl" Introduced by Chinese Paper
articles.content:
DPRK's Opera "The Flower Girl" Introduced by Chinese Paper
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The Chinese paper Jilin Ribao on May 9 carried article titled "'The Flower Girl' of DPRK's Phibada Opera Troupe visits Jilin Province again."
					 Opera "The Flower Girl" of the DPRK's Phibada Opera Troupe, a world's famous art troupe with the highest level, is to give premiere at the Dongfang Grand Theatre in Changchun City, Jilin Province at special invitation, the paper said, and went on:
					
					 The Korean film "The Flower Girl" whose song says "A thousand nay a ten thousand azaleas, sincerity devoted to the mother are brought into bloom like the flower" not only touched the heartstrings of lots of Chinese in the 1970s but it still bears witness to the long history of China-DPRK friendship.
					
					 This opera will again move Chinese this time. It has been performed in the DPRK and foreign countries for more than 1 400 times. 
					
					 The opera troupe made a performance tour of China in 2008. At that time it was performed five times at the State Grand Theatre in Beijing. Admission tickets were all sold out a week ago, making it very difficult to buy a ticket. The host side could not but organize additional performances at the Great Hall of the People. This was something rare to be seen in the performing history in China.
					
					 After the first performance in Changchun, the opera troupe is to make performance tour of Beijing and different provinces and cities. The current visit will mark an important occasion in injecting fresh energy into the cultural life of the Chinese people.

articles.title: China-US Confrontation in Pacific
articles.content:
China-US Confrontation in Pacific
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The U.S. is contemplating staging large-scale joint military exercises in the waters east of Kyushu Island of Japan with Japan and Australia from June 6. This saber-rattling is chiefly aimed at weakening the nuclear deterrent of China. This was commented by Russian experts.
					 Voice of Russia said:
					
					 The start of deployment of the U.S. missile defense system in Asia was officially proclaimed in April and it is reported that its elements will be deployed in Japan, south Korea and Australia.
					
					 The chief editor of the magazine Defense Security said: The drill will demonstrate the capability of the missile defense system to be established in the future. The U.S. is zealously pushing forward the deployment of its missile defense system in Asia and expecting its allies not only to render military support but participate in the development of Aegis system. It is pinning hope on Japan, in particular. Experts assert that the drill is aimed at weakening the strategic nuclear deterrent of China.
					
					 The vice-president of the Academy of Geopolitics recollected that the U.S. listed China as a main geopolitical rival in the new national security strategy adopted at the end of last year. The U.S. is regarding the drill as a good opportunity of demonstrating its muscle to China, he said, and went on:
					
					 The MD pushed forward by the U.S. in the Asia-Pacific region is totally targeted on China. The drill is aimed to round off the equipment to use armed forces and means according to MD. The basic features of MD in Asia lie in that radar detection systems and elements for intercepting ballistic missiles are based in the sea.
					
					 In late April China and Russia staged the largest-ever joint military exercises in the East Sea of China in the recent period. Many experts termed the drill a cooperative step for strengthening common security as it was staged after the U.S. proclaimed the establishment of MD in Asia. In the final analysis, Asia tops the world list of joint military exercises in terms of their scale and number.

articles.title: Russia Is Opposed to US Sanctions on Iran: FM
articles.content:
Russia Is Opposed to US Sanctions on Iran: FM
 Moscow, May 29 (KCNA) -- Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov in his recent speech clarified the country's stand opposed to the U.S. sanctions on Iran.
					 He flatly rejected the U.S. Senate approval of a bill for a new round of sanctions on Iran.
					
					 The extraterritorial sanctions on Iran are obviously intolerable, he said, adding their aim is to strangle Iran's economy, not just to fight the threats of the spread of the weapons of mass destruction.

articles.title: US Unjust Stand on Missile Shield under Fire
articles.content:
US Unjust Stand on Missile Shield under Fire
 Moscow, May 29 (KCNA) -- The commander of the Aerospace Defense Force of Russia recently denounced the unjust stand of the U.S. on the issue of missile shield.
					 He branded the U.S. measure as a sordid behavior not to cooperate with Russia over the MD issue.
					
					 He stressed that the operation of a new radar station of Russia encompassing the southeastern perimeter with potential missile threat would serve as another measure for bolstering the defence capabilities of the country.

articles.title: Japan's Prefectural Governor Demands Stop to US Army's Night Flight Drill
articles.content:
Japan's Prefectural Governor Demands Stop to US Army's Night Flight Drill
 Pyongyang, May 30 (KCNA) -- The governor of Kanagawa Prefecture of Japan recently met the commander of a U.S. military base in Atsugi to strongly demand a stop to the U.S. Air Force's night flight exercise.
					 The governor expressed opposition to the U.S. army's renewed night flight drill at its base in the prefecture.
					
					 Expressing fear, the governor said the exercise in such a densely-populated area is intolerable.

articles.title: MINREX rechaza el "informe de DDHH para 2011" de EE.UU.
articles.content:
MINREX rechaza el "informe de DDHH para 2011" de EE.UU.
Pyongyang, 30 de mayo (ACNC) -- El vocero del Ministerio de Relaciones Exteriores de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dio a la publicidad el dia 29 una declaracion para condenar el "informe de DDHH para 2011" publicado el dia 24 por EE.UU. con el fin de calumniar siniestramente a la RPDC y otros paises independientes que se oponen a su dominacionismo.
					Utilizar el problema de DDHH como aparato politico para la implementacion de su estrategia de dominio mundial es el vicio cronico de EE.UU., comienza la nota y continua:
					
					Si algunos paises obedecen docilmente, EE.UU. los indulta independientemente de su situacion de DDHH, pero en el caso de los que rechazan su dominio, los tilda de "culpables". Esto es el juicio de DDHH que EE.UU. repite todos los anos.
					
					Por supuesto, la RPDC es cuestionada cada ano en ese informe porque es el pais al que hostiliza mas EE.UU.
					
					El invariable embuste de EE.UU. sobre el supuesto problema de DDHH en la RPDC es, en su esencia, un producto de su politica hostil sobre ella para aplastar el regimen socialista optado por el pueblo coreano y al mismo tiempo, una violacion flagrante de DDHH que niega el derecho del pueblo de un pais a tomar la opcion deseada.
					
					La RPDC denuncia y rechaza categoricamente ese pueril informe de DDHH que redacta EE.UU., autodenominado como "Estado legal" y "potencia de inteligencia", recogiendo los "rumores" inventados para ganarse la vida por un punado de traidores y criminales que salieron ilegalmente del pais abandonando su patria y sus familiares.
					
					Es muy natural que numerosos paises del mundo condenaran mordazmente el informe calificandolo del climax de politizacion y pauta de doble rasero en el tema de DDHH y del basurero de datos tergiversados y fraudulentos de toda indole.
					
					Desde el principio, EE.UU. viene recurriendo por decadas a la amenaza militar y al chantaje nuclear para atropellar con la fuerza a la RPDC. Pero, no tuvo otro resultado que el nacimiento de nuevo portador de armas nucleares y el fortalecimiento continuo del disuasivo nuclear de la RPDC.
					
					Por eso, EE.UU. plantea ultimamente el "problema de DDHH" y el "de vida del pueblo".
					
					Si bien las altas autoridades norteamericanas hablan estos dias como si estuvieran interesadas en la "vida del pueblo" de la RPDC, son ellas mismas las que obstaculizan mas obstinada y cabalmente el desarrollo economico y el mejoramiento de las condiciones de la vida del pueblo de aquella.
					
					El 15 de abril, el Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un manifesto solemnemente al interior y exterior del pais la firme decision del Partido del Trabajo de Corea de evitar que el pueblo coreano vuelva a sufrir la escasez economica y hacerle vivir en la opulencia y el lujo bajo el socialismo.
					
					Al dia siguiente, EE.UU. cometio el acto criminal de imponer nuevamente la sancion economica contra la RPDC cuestionando el lanzamiento de satelite artificial con fines pacificos.
					
					Hay que impedir que un pais hostilizado fortalezca su defensa nacional, para este fin hace falta privarlo de tecnologias o sustancias de doble uso aunque eso afecte su desarrollo economico pacifico. Esto es la logica de bandido de EE.UU.
					
					EE.UU. impide con acciones el desarrollo economico de la RPDC y aboga con palabras por la "vida del pueblo", lo cual forma parte de la campana psicologica que persigue el necio intento de socavar la unidad monolitica y desestabilizar el interior de la segunda.
					
					Mientras insista en su anacronica politica hostil anti-RPDC, EE.UU. no tendra ni el derecho moral de plantear el problema de DDHH y el de la vida del pueblo.
					
					Resulta absurdisimo que se desempene como "juez internacional de DDHH" ese pais que reprime salvajemente las manifestaciones anti-Wall Street y las anti-belicas de las masas trabajadoras levantadas contra el regimen capitalista y la politica guerrerista de las autoridades y mata por doquier del mundo a cientos de miles de civiles inocentes.
					
					Si EE.UU. sigue vulgarizando el tema de DDHH usandolo como herramienta politica en funcion de sus objetivos egoistas, no saldra nunca del aislamiento de la sociedad internacional como le ensena la avalancha de criticas internacionales sobre su reciente informe.

articles.title: Premier coreano visita el Complejo Quimico de Sunchon
articles.content:
Premier coreano visita el Complejo Quimico de Sunchon
Pyongyang, 30 de mayo (ACNC) -- El premier Choe Yong Rim, miembro del Presidium del Buro Politico del Comite Central del Partido del Trabajo de Corea, averiguo el dia 30 en el terreno el estado de operacion del Complejo Quimico de Sunchon.
					 Esa empresa, donde esta grabadas las hazanas de guia de los grandes hombres del monte Paektu, modernizo los procesos importantes, inclusive el de produccion del alcohol metilico, y establecio el sistema de direccion general de la produccion en pleno acato al legado del Dirigente Kim Jong Il.
					
					 De esta manera, sento la base material y tecnica para normalizar en alto nivel la produccion de vinalon.
					
					  En los talleres de carburo de calcio e hilado y otros puntos, el premier aprecio la lucha de la clase obrera del complejo que impulsa la obra de modernizacion segun el proposito del partido.
					
					  Luego, indico las tareas, tales como realizar con responsabilidad el cuidado tecnico y de equipos del proceso productivo de carburo de calcio, acelerar la labor para diversificar los productos quimicos fabricando al mismo tiempo varios productos quimicos basicos y modernizar a buen ritmo los equipos viejos y atrasados aprovechando eficientemente la base ya preparada.
					
					 Reitero que los funcionarios y obreros deben terminar en un corto plazo la modernizacion del proceso de produccion de vinalon bajo la consigna de "!Superemos en todo los niveles de punta!".
					
					  Se asignaron las tareas a las unidades vinculadas para que ellas suministren en lo suficiente las materias primas y materiales necesarios a la modernizacion del complejo.
					
					El premier subrayo que el complejo debe cumplir el papel en desarrollar la economia del pais y mejorar la vida del pueblo prestando la profunda atencion a la vida de los obreros con la noble concepcion del pueblo del Maximo Dirigente       Kim Jong Un, quien aprecia a la clase obrera como valioso tesoro del pais.

articles.title: Minju Joson condena la maniobra "Thaeguk" desarrollada en Sudcorea
articles.content:
Minju Joson condena la maniobra "Thaeguk" desarrollada en Sudcorea
Pyongyang, 30 de mayo (ACNC) -- A los pocos dias de los ejercicios de combate aereo de mayor envergadura en la historia que libro del dia 7 al 18 con Estados Unidos, la banda del traidor surcoreano Lee Myung Bak desplego demencialmente del 21 al 25 la otra maniobra de guerra "Thaeguk" bajo el pretexto de hacer frente a diversas "amenazas de provocacion" de alguien.
					Recuerda el periodico Minju Joson en un comentario individual difundido este miercoles y continua:
					
					Los sucesivos ejercicios militares son una prueba de que la camarilla surcoreana intenta desatar la guerra de agresion al Norte (de Corea) en contubernio con las fuerzas foraneas.
					
					El que provoca en la Peninsula Coreana no es la RPDC sino el imperialismo norteamericano y la banda de Lee.
					
					En la mencionada maniobra aerea, el imperio movilizo el avion nodriza y AWACS cuyo radio de operaciones sobrepasa la dimension de la Peninsula Coreana. Es decir, EE.UU. toma como blanco de su ataque aereo no solo a la RPDC sino el Nordeste Asiatico entero.
					
					Practicamente, EE.UU. despliega en esa region mas fuerzas armadas segun su nueva estrategia de defensa nacional que se enfoca en Asia-Pacifico. Asi trata de conquistar con las fuerzas la Peninsula Coreana y dominar la region de Asia-Pacifico usandola como trampolin.
					
					Por su parte, los titeres surcoreanos agravan la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y el resto de Asia imputando a la RPDC la responsabilidad de la catastrofica situacion de esa peninsula y ofreciendose como ejecutores materiales de la guerra nuclear de EE.UU.
					
					Los hechos demuestran que los autores principales del empeoramiento de relaciones intercoreanas y de la peligrosa coyuntura dada en la Peninsula Coreana y el resto de Asia son precisamente Estados Unidos y la banda ratonesca de Lee Myung Bak.

articles.title: ACNC comenta intervencion de EE.UU. en elecciones de Sur de Corea
articles.content:
ACNC comenta intervencion de EE.UU. en elecciones de Sur de Corea
Pyongyang, 30 de mayo (ACNC) -- Las sucesivas visitas al Sur de Corea y los debates de conspiracion de los especialistas en el problema coreano de Estados Unidos levantan fuertes sospechas dentro y fuera del pais, especialmente, entre los surcoreanos de diferentes sectores.
					La delegacion de la Camara de Representantes de EE.UU., encabezada por el presidente de su comite de relaciones exteriores, arribo el dia 23 al Sur de Corea.
					
					Seguidamente, lo hicieron los especialistas en el problema de la Peninsula Coreana del Centro Norteamericano para los Estudios Estrategicos e Internacionales y los ex altos funcionarios de EE.UU. que se reunieron por separado con el traidor Lee Myung Bak, Park Geun-hye y otras figuras conservadoras proyanquis.
					
					Se dice que ellos preconizaron en esas ocasiones la "cooperacion" y "reaccion conjunta" en el "problema nuclear y de misil" y el "de derechos humanos" de alguien y se mostraron "muy interesados" en las "elecciones presidenciales" del Sur de Corea programadas para diciembre.
					
					Este hecho deja conocer el siniestro intento de EE.UU. de cobijar a las fuerzas conservadoras ultraderechistas del Sur de Corea, que se pusieron al frente en el cumplimiento de la politica hostil a la RPDC, y prolongar el "poder" conservador proyanqui en el Sur de Corea para atropellarla cueste lo que cueste.
					
					Como ya conocido, desde hace mucho tiempo, el imperio viene interviniendo y controlando los asuntos internos del Sur de Corea.
					
					Puesto que el Sur de Corea es una posicion importante para la realizacion de la estrategia norteamericana sobre Asia, la administracion norteamericana persigue fortalecer el dominio politico-militar sobre el primero.
					
					Para este fin, considera como importante tarea de su politica exterior asegurar el cambio del regimen surcoreano sin que se altere su caracter titere y proyanqui. Detras de la asuncion y el fin de los sucesivos "presidentes" surcoreanos, estuvo siempre la mano de EE.UU.
					
					Hoy dia tambien, EE.UU. se dedica a los complots anti-RPDC instigando a los neoconservadores y conservadores surcoreanos, al tiempo de poner mas tensa que nunca la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana.
					
					Las garras de EE.UU. se echan en el Sur de Corea justamente cuando los traidores encabezados por Lee Myung Bak lanzan ultimamente una brutal campana de represion contra las entidades y personalidades progresistas y partidarias de reunificacion, abogando por la llamada "purga de fuerzas pro-Norte".
					
					Al invertir a toda costa la situacion de "elecciones presidenciales" que seran un juicio contra el actual "poder" surcoreano, EE.UU. pretende mantener vigente la actual politica proyanqui del traidor Lee y reproducir la peor dictadura proyanqui apoyando al "Partido Saenuri", agrupacion de traidores proyanquis, y a la hija del dictador de "renovacion".
					
					 Como ensenan los hechos, mientras continue el dominio politico-militar de EE.UU. sobre el Sur de Corea, no se puede esperar nunca en la sociedad surcoreana la independencia verdadera, ni la democratizacion, ni el exito del movimiento por la reunificacion.
					
					Es muy justo que los habitantes de diversos estratos y los jovenes surcoreanos rechacen la politica vendepatria y servil a EE.UU. de la camarilla de Lee.
